medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever of unknown origin and nodular skin lesions.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with nodular skin lesions of approximately 4 weeks duration, intermittent fevers (38.3°C–38.9°C), fatigue, poor appetite, and a 12-pound weight loss over the same period. Symptoms were preceded by several months of intermittently productive cough.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prior diagnosis of disseminated Mycobacterium szulgai lung infection in August 2007, lymphocytopenia, monocytopenia, and neutropenia at that time, with treatment including right upper lobectomy and 18 months of anti-mycobacterial therapy. History of recurrent ear infections, multiple episodes of community-acquired pneumonia, and recurrent warts on hands and feet.
medical_history.family_history: Brother had recurrent warts but was otherwise healthy; mother and sister were healthy; father died of acute bowel infarction.
